00020 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00021 // Generic helper function to create a calibration matrix.
00022 // Assumes the camera center is the center of the image.
00023 
00024 static inline vpgl_calibration_matrix<double> create_k(
00025     bundler_inters_image_sptr const& img)
00026 {
00027     vgl_point_2d<double> principal_point;
00028     principal_point.x() = img->source->ni() / 2.0;
00029     principal_point.y() = img->source->nj() / 2.0;
00030 
00031     return
00032         vpgl_calibration_matrix<double>(img->focal_length, principal_point);
00033 }
00034 
00035 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00036 // Returns true if a matches the criteria for being in the
00037 // initial reconstruction. a must have a focal length from exif
00038 // tags for both images, and have more than the minimum number of
00039 // features.
00040 bool bundler_sfm_impl_create_initial_recon::can_be_initial_recon(
00041     const bundler_inters_match_set &a)
00042 {
00043     return
00044         a.num_features() >= settings.min_number_of_matches_homography &&
00045         a.image1->focal_length != BUNDLER_NO_FOCAL_LEN &&
00046         a.image2->focal_length != BUNDLER_NO_FOCAL_LEN;
00047 }
00048 
00049 // Chooses two images from the set to create the initial reconstruction
00050 bool bundler_sfm_impl_create_initial_recon::operator()(
00051     bundler_inters_reconstruction &recon)
00052 {
00053     const double t =
00054         settings.inlier_threshold_homography *
00055         settings.inlier_threshold_homography;
00056 
00057     const int r = settings.number_ransac_rounds_homography;
00058 
00059     // First step: Find the two images to base the reconstruction on.
00060     // We do this by selecting the match in the set that is modeled the
00061     // worst by a homography (i.e. has the fewest number of inliers).
00062     bundler_inters_match_set *best_match = NULL;
00063     double best_inlier_p = 1.0;
00064 
00065     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set>::iterator i;
00066     for (i = recon.match_sets.begin(); i != recon.match_sets.end(); ++i)
00067     {
00068         const bool replace_best = can_be_initial_recon(*i) &&
00069             best_inlier_p > i->get_homography_inlier_percentage(t, r);
00070 
00071         if ( replace_best ) {
00072             best_match = &(*i);
00073             best_inlier_p =
00074                 best_match->get_homography_inlier_percentage(t,r);
00075         }
00076     }
00077 
00078     // If we didn't find anything that can be in the initial
00079     // reconstruction, panic.
00080     if ( ! best_match) {
00081         vcl_cerr<< "Unable to create an initial reconstruction!\n"
00082                 << "There is not a match set that both has an initial guess"
00083                 << " from EXIF tags and at least "
00084                 << settings.min_number_of_matches_homography
00085                 << " matches.\n";
00086         return false;
00087     }
00088 
00089     assert(can_be_initial_recon(*best_match));
00090 
00091     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00092     // We have the best match, so create two calibration matrices for
00093     // the image pair.
00094     vpgl_calibration_matrix<double> k1 = create_k(best_match->image1);
00095     vpgl_calibration_matrix<double> k2 = create_k(best_match->image2);
00096 
00097 
00098     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00099     // Use the five-point algorithm wrapped in RANSAC to find the
00100     // relative pose.
00101     vpgl_em_compute_5_point_ransac<double> five_point_ransac(
00102         settings.number_ransac_rounds_e_matrix,
00103         settings.inlier_threshold_e_matrix,
00104         false);
00105 
00106     vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> > right_points(
00107         best_match->num_features());
00108     vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> > left_points(
00109         best_match->num_features());
00110 
00111     for (int i = 0; i < best_match->num_features(); ++i) {
00112         right_points[i] = best_match->matches[i].first->point;
00113         left_points[i] = best_match->matches[i].second->point;
00114     }
00115 
00116     vpgl_essential_matrix<double> best_em;
00117     five_point_ransac.compute(
00118         right_points, k1,
00119         left_points, k2,
00120         best_em);
00121 
00122 
00123     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00124     // Get the two cameras.
00125 
00126     // Set the right camera to be have no translation or rotation.
00127     best_match->image1->camera =
00128         vpgl_perspective_camera<double>();
00129 
00130     best_match->image1->camera.set_calibration(k1);
00131 
00132 
00133     // Get two normalized (focal plane) coordinates so that we can
00134     // choose the direction of the left camera.
00135     vgl_point_2d<double> pt_left =
00136         k2.map_to_focal_plane(best_match->matches[0].second->point);
00137 
00138     vgl_point_2d<double> pt_right =
00139         k1.map_to_focal_plane(best_match->matches[0].first->point);
00140 
00141     // Extract the left camera from the essential matrix
00142     best_match->image2->camera.set_calibration(k2);
00143 
00144     extract_left_camera(
00145         best_em,
00146         vgl_point_2d<double>(pt_left.x(), pt_left.y()),
00147         vgl_point_2d<double>(pt_right.x(), pt_right.y()),
00148         best_match->image2->camera);
00149 
00150 
00151     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00152     // Triangulate the points that both observe.
00153     for (int i = 0; i < best_match->num_features(); ++i)
00154     {
00155         bundler_inters_feature_sptr f1 = best_match->matches[i].first;
00156         bundler_inters_feature_sptr f2 = best_match->matches[i].second;
00157 
00158         assert(f1->image != f2->image);
00159 
00160         // Get the track these both belong to.
00161         bundler_inters_track_sptr &track =
00162             best_match->matches[i].first->track;
00163 
00164         // Tell the images that they have a feature used to triangulate
00165         // a world point.
00166         f1->image->in_recon = true;
00167         f2->image->in_recon = true;
00168 
00169         // Tell the track to use these two features as contributing pts.
00170         const int side1_ind = f1->index_in_track;
00171         const int side2_ind = f2->index_in_track;
00172 
00173         track->contributing_points[side1_ind] = true;
00174         track->contributing_points[side2_ind] = true;
00175 
00176         track->observed = true;
00177 
00178         // Find the world point given these two image points
00179         track->world_point = triangulate_3d_point<double>(
00180             f1->image->camera,
00181             f1->point,
00182             f2->image->camera,
00183             f2->point);
00184     }
00185 
00186     return true;
00187 }
00188

00190 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 // to_check is a collection of features, and a source image. This represents
00192 // an unprocessed camera. We want to see how many points which we have
00193 // already processed this camera observes.
00194 static int count_observed_points(
00195     const bundler_inters_image_sptr &to_check)
00196 {
00197     int num_observed_pts = 0;
00198 
00199     assert( ! to_check->in_recon );
00200 
00201     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator ii;
00202     for (ii = to_check->features.begin();
00203          ii != to_check->features.end(); ++ii)
00204     {
00205         if ((*ii)->track && (*ii)->track->observed) {
00206             ++num_observed_pts;
00207         }
00208     }
00209 
00210     return num_observed_pts;
00211 }

00213 // Takes in reconstruction and track_set, fills to_add as a return val.
00214 bool bundler_sfm_impl_select_next_images::operator()(
00215     bundler_inters_reconstruction &recon,
00216     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &to_add)
00217 {
00218     // Look at every image
00219     int most_observed_points = 0;
00220     bundler_inters_image_sptr next_image;
00221 
00222     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00223     for (i = recon.feature_sets.begin(); i != recon.feature_sets.end(); ++i)
00224     {
00225         // Only look at images not in the reconstruction.
00226         if (! (*i)->in_recon ) {
00227             // Find the number of points that this camera views,
00228             // which are also viewed by a camera already added.
00229             const int num_observed_points =
00230                 count_observed_points(*i);
00231 
00232             if (num_observed_points > most_observed_points) {
00233                 next_image = *i;
00234                 most_observed_points = num_observed_points;
00235             }
00236         }
00237     }
00238 
00239 
00240     // Because we wanted this class to be very general, we need to return
00241     // a vector. Put the next image to add into the vector.
00242     if (most_observed_points >= settings.min_number_observed_points) {
00243         assert(next_image);
00244 
00245         to_add.push_back(next_image);
00246         return true;
00247     }
00248     else {
00249         return false;
00250     }
00251 }

00253 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00254 class image_adder
00255 {
00256   public:
00257     image_adder(
00258         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> *added_cameras,
00259         int r,
00260         double t) :
00261         added_cameras(added_cameras),
00262         rounds(r),
00263         thresh(t) { }
00264 
00265     void operator()(const bundler_inters_image_sptr &img) {
00266         // Get the associated vpgl camera using RANSAC
00267         bundler_utils_fill_persp_camera_ransac(
00268             img, rounds, thresh);
00269 
00270         img->in_recon = true;
00271 
00272         added_cameras->push_back(img);
00273     }
00274 
00275   private:
00276     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> *added_cameras;
00277     int rounds;
00278     double thresh;
00279 };

00281 
00282 // Adds to_add_set to the reconstruction.
00283 void bundler_sfm_impl_add_next_images::operator()(
00284     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &to_add,
00285 
00286     bundler_inters_reconstruction &reconstruction,
00287     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &added_cameras)
00288 {
00289     // Create an image adder
00290     image_adder adder(
00291         &added_cameras,
00292         settings.number_ransac_rounds,
00293         settings.inlier_size_multiplier);
00294 
00295     // Add every image in the set.
00296     vcl_for_each(to_add.begin(), to_add.end(), adder);
00297 
00298     assert(added_cameras.size() == to_add.size());
00299 }

00302 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00303 // Returns true if the track has the right number of points that are
00304 // observed by cameras in the reconstruction, and the maximum angle is
00305 // no less than angle_thresh
00306 static bool can_be_added(
00307     const bundler_inters_track_sptr &track,
00308     int num_observed_thresh,
00309     double angle_thresh)
00310 {
00311     double max_angle = 180;
00312     int num_observed;
00313 
00314     //TODO: Check angle
00315 
00316     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::iterator f;
00317     for (f = track->points.begin(); f != track->points.end(); ++f) {
00318         if ( (*f)->image->in_recon ) { ++num_observed; }
00319     }
00320 
00321     return max_angle >= angle_thresh && num_observed >= num_observed_thresh;
00322 }
00323 
00324 
00325 static void add_new_track(
00326     bundler_inters_reconstruction &reconstruction,
00327     bundler_inters_track_sptr &track)
00328 {
00329     assert(!track->observed);
00330 
00331     // Count the number of points this track now observes.
00332     unsigned int num_observing_points = 0;
00333 
00334     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator p;
00335     for (p = track->points.begin(); p != track->points.end(); ++p) {
00336         if ((*p)->image->in_recon) {
00337             ++num_observing_points;
00338         }
00339     }
00340 
00341     // If there are enough points to triangulate, add this track to the recon.
00342     if (num_observing_points >= 2)
00343     {
00344         // Mark all the points whose image is in the reconstruction
00345         // as contributing.
00346         for (p = track->points.begin(); p != track->points.end(); ++p) {
00347             if ((*p)->image->in_recon) {
00348                 const int ind = p - track->points.begin();
00349 
00350                 track->contributing_points[ind] = true;
00351             }
00352         }
00353 
00354         // Find the world point for this track by triangulating
00355         // all the contributing points.
00356         bundler_utils_triangulate_points(track);
00357 
00358         // Set this track as observed.
00359         track->observed = true;
00360     }
00361 }
00362 
00363 
00364 void bundler_sfm_impl_add_new_points::operator()(
00365     bundler_inters_reconstruction &recon,
00366     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &added)
00367 {
00368     int num_points_added = 0;
00369 
00370     //Look at every image that was added in the last round.
00371     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00372     for (i = added.begin(); i != added.end(); ++i)
00373     {
00374         // Look at every feature in this image. If the track that
00375         // it is part of is already observed, mark the point as
00376         // contributing in it's track so that during bundle adjustment,
00377         // the new point will be considered. If the track is not observed,
00378         // we need to check if we should add it. We add the track if it
00379         // has at least two features that are part of an added image, and
00380         // if the triangulation is well-defined.
00381         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::iterator f;
00382         for (f = (*i)->features.begin(); f != (*i)->features.end(); ++f)
00383         {
00384             if ( ! (*f)->track ) {
00385                 // Some points aren't in tracks (for instance, a view of a
00386                 // 3D point that is only visible in a single image). Skip
00387                 // these, since single point can't be triangulated.
00388                 continue;
00389             }
00390             else if ( (*f)->track->observed ) {
00391                 (*f)->mark_as_contributing();
00392             }
00393             else if (can_be_added(
00394                         (*f)->track,
00395                         settings.min_observing_images,
00396                         settings.min_ray_angle)) {
00397                 add_new_track(recon, (*f)->track);
00398                 num_points_added++;
00399             }
00400         }
00401     }
00402 
00403     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr>::const_iterator t;
00404     for (t = recon.tracks.begin(); t != recon.tracks.end(); ++t) {
00405         if ( (*t)->observed) {
00406             bundler_utils_triangulate_points(*t);
00407         }
00408     }
00409 
00410     vcl_cout << "Added " << num_points_added << " points\n";
00411 }

00415 
00416 class track_membership_tester
00417 {
00418   public:
00419     track_membership_tester(const bundler_inters_track_sptr &t) :
00420         track(t) { }
00421 
00422     bool operator()(const bundler_inters_feature_sptr &f) {
00423         return f->track == track;
00424     }
00425 
00426   private:
00427    bundler_inters_track_sptr track;
00428 };
00429 
00430 // Returns true if img contains a feature which is the projection
00431 // of world_point, false otherwise. If such a feature exists, pt
00432 // is filled with the feature's location in the image.
00433 static bool find_point_in_image(
00434     const bundler_inters_image_sptr &img,
00435     const bundler_inters_track_sptr &world_point,
00436     vgl_point_2d<double> &pt)
00437 {
00438     // Try and find the world_point in img.
00439     track_membership_tester pred(world_point);
00440 
00441     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::iterator found =
00442         vcl_find_if (img->features.begin(), img->features.end(), pred);
00443 
00444 
00445     // If we found a feature, fill pt with its location in the image.
00446     if ( found != img->features.end()) {
00447         pt = (*found)->point;
00448     }
00449 
00450     return found != img->features.end();
00451 }

00453 
00454 // Adjusts the reconstruction using nonlinear least squares
00455 void bundler_sfm_impl_bundle_adjust::operator()(
00456     bundler_inters_reconstruction &recon)
00457 {
00458     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00459     // Get the reconstruction into something the bundle adjust routine
00460     // will use.
00461 
00462     // Get a list of the perspective cameras currently in
00463     // the reconstruction
00464     vcl_vector<vpgl_perspective_camera<double> > cameras;
00465 
00466     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00467     for (i = recon.feature_sets.begin(); i != recon.feature_sets.end(); ++i)
00468     {
00469         if ( (*i)->in_recon ) {
00470             cameras.push_back( (*i)->camera );
00471         }
00472     }
00473 
00474 
00475     // Get a list of all the currently estimated 3D points.
00476     vcl_vector<vgl_point_3d<double> > world_points;
00477 
00478     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr>::const_iterator t;
00479     for (t = recon.tracks.begin(); t != recon.tracks.end(); ++t)
00480     {
00481         if ( (*t)->observed ) {
00482             world_points.push_back( (*t)->world_point );
00483         }
00484     }
00485 
00486 
00487     // Get a mask which holds visibility information and the 2d points
00488     //
00489     // mask[i][j] is true if world point j is visible in image i, false o.w.
00490     //
00491     // mask= [[is point 0 visible in cam 0, is point 0 visible in cam 1],
00492     //     is point 1 visible in cam 0, is point 1 visible in cam 1]]
00493     vcl_vector< vgl_point_2d<double> > image_points;
00494 
00495     vcl_vector<vcl_vector<bool> > mask( cameras.size(),
00496                                         vcl_vector<bool>(world_points.size(), false) );
00497 
00498     unsigned int camera_ind = 0; // Which entry in cameras are we on.
00499     for (i = recon.feature_sets.begin(); i != recon.feature_sets.end(); ++i)
00500     {
00501         // If this image is not in the reconstruction, then its
00502         // camera is not in the cameras list. If this is the case,
00503         // skip this camera.
00504         if ( ! (*i)->in_recon) { continue; }
00505 
00506         unsigned int point_ind = 0; // Which entry in world_points are we on.
00507         for (t = recon.tracks.begin(); t != recon.tracks.end(); ++t)
00508         {
00509             // If this track is not observed, then it is not in
00510             // world_points, so skip it.
00511             if ( ! (*t)->observed) { continue; }
00512 
00513             vgl_point_2d<double> image_pt;
00514             if ( find_point_in_image(*i, *t, image_pt) )
00515             {
00516                 mask[camera_ind][point_ind] = true;
00517                 image_points.push_back(image_pt);
00518             }
00519 
00520             // If we skipped the image, this won't get updated, since
00521             // we're still looking for the bundler_track that holds
00522             // world_points[point_ind]. But, since we're at this point in
00523             // the code, we've found that point, so move on.
00524             ++point_ind;
00525         }
00526 
00527         assert(point_ind == world_points.size());
00528 
00529         ++camera_ind;
00530     }
00531 
00532     assert(camera_ind == cameras.size());
00533 
00534     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00535     // Perform the bundle adjustment
00536     vpgl_bundle_adjust bundle_adjust;
00537     bundle_adjust.set_verbose(true);
00538     bundle_adjust.set_normalize_data(false);
00539     bundle_adjust.write_vrml("bundle.vrml", cameras, world_points);
00540 
00541     assert(bundle_adjust.optimize(cameras, world_points, image_points, mask));
00542 
00543     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00544     // Extract the information from the bundle adjustment process.
00545     unsigned int camera_index = 0;
00546     for (i = recon.feature_sets.begin(); i != recon.feature_sets.end(); ++i)
00547     {
00548         if ( (*i)->in_recon ) {
00549             (*i)->camera = cameras[camera_index];
00550             ++camera_index;
00551         }
00552     }
00553 
00554     assert(camera_index == cameras.size());
00555 
00556     unsigned int point_index = 0;
00557     for (t = recon.tracks.begin(); t != recon.tracks.end(); ++t)
00558     {
00559         if ( (*t)->observed ) {
00560             (*t)->world_point = world_points[point_index];
00561             ++point_index;
00562         }
00563     }
00564 
00565     assert(point_index == world_points.size());
00566 }
